alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 6:24PM EDT until March 14 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM EDT MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MONDAY TO 5 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, around 1 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 3 AM EDT Monday. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 11 PM Monday to 5 AM EDT Tuesday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas, particularly the late Monday Night/early Tuesday AM high tide. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...4 to 7 ft breaking waves will result i beach erosion and flooding along the oceanfront during the times of high tide with only minor erosion to dune structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain during the times of high tide will likely exacerbate street flooding in coastal communities. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
